src:
Najraje slika hmeljeve kupice
Na Vranskem razstava Franca Markoviča - Aca. Avgust Pikl ima v zbirki dvesto njegovih del.
06 Nov 2019, 16:35 by Darko Naraglav



Aco z bratom Nikom, uspešnim rokometnim trenerjem, in Avgustom Piklom (v sredini) FOTOGRAFIJE: Darko Naraglav



Za humorni del je poskrbela Acova žena Olga.



Umetniška družina Markovič. Na fotografiji manjka sin Grega, ki je prav tako nadarjen ustvarjalec.



Moderatorka Tanja Goropevšek


V muzejski Schwentnerjevi hiši na Vranskem, kjer se je rodil Lavoslav Schwentner, ljubljanski knjigarnar ter založnik pesnikov in pisateljev moderne, je svojo plodno slikarsko pot zaznamoval umetnik Franc Markovič - Aco. V Spodnjo Savinjsko dolino se je iz rodne Črne na Koroškem skupaj s starši in dvema bratoma preselil še kot otrok. Postal je znan predvsem po slikanju hmeljevih kupic, tihožitij in narave. Da se v njem pretaka koroško-štajerska kri, se odraža tudi v njegovem značaju: je koroško trmast, a ima štajerski smisel za humor, je ob odprtju razstave dejala njegova hči Nina Markovič Korent. Dogodek so z glasbo popestrili Miro Klinc ter njegova hči Marina in njen mož Franjo Oset, tudi član ansambla Modrijani. Za humorno vzdušje je poskrbela kar umetnikova žena Olga Markovič, ki je neumorna kulturna ustvarjalka in predsednica Krajevne skupnosti Griže. Razstavo je odprl vranski župan Franc Sušnik, moderatorka prireditve pa je bila Tanja Goropevšek iz ZKTŠ Vransko.Petdeset let likovnega ustvarjanja zagotovo ni malo. V tem času je Aco vedno trmasto vztrajal na lastni, čeprav pogosto osamljeni slikarski poti. Vedno je cenil svobodo, zato je tudi kot samostojni kulturni delavec pri svojem delu sledil lastni poti in želel biti drugačen. Njegovi razstavni prostori so bili vedno nekaj posebnega. V Srbiji je na primer prejel priznanje mesta Beograd za stojnico igrač, zelo izvirni so bili razstavni prostori za velenjski Modni salon. Čeprav se nerad hvali s svojimi uspehi, naj kljub temu omenimo nekatere. Na ex tempore v Piranu je bila, ko je prvič sodeloval na tem likovnem dogodku, njegova slika izbrana za prvo odkupno nagrado. Na razstavi v Stadt Galerie v Leibnitzu je bil že leta 1988 med slikarji edini Slovenec in prvi dan je prodal vse slike. Prejel je več nagrad in priznanj, ob 40-letnici njegovega ustvarjanja tudi Savinovo nagrado. Toda ne slika zaradi nagrad in priznanj, slika, ker je likovno ustvarjanje njegova ljubezen, strast, njegovo poslanstvo.


Za humorni del je poskrbela Acova žena Olga.

V vseh letih je v različnih tehnikah, med njimi olje na platnu, akril in pastel, naslikal več sto hmeljišč, slike pa zdaj krasijo domove po Savinjski dolini in drugod po Sloveniji pa tudi v tujini. Zelo blizu so mu motivi tihožitij, lovski motivi, motivi krajin in šopkov ter figuralike – predice, starčki, otroci … Del njegovega opusa so tudi petelini iz vrst ruševcev, primorski motivi, stare barkače in stara morska mesta. Njegove slike s primorskimi motivi so krasile obalne galerije po različnih mestih na Jadranu. Tokratna razstavljena dela je na ogled postavil njegov dolgoletni prijatelj Avgust Pikl - Gustl, ki ima v svoji zbirki okrog dvesto njegovih del.


Moderatorka Tanja Goropevšek
text:
I prefer a picture of a hop cup
Exhibition of Franz Markovic - Aca in Vransko. August Pikl has two hundred of his works in the collection.
06 Nov 2019, 15:35 by Darko Naraglav



Aco with his brother Nick, a successful handball coach, and August Pikel (center) PHOTOS: Darko Naraglav



The humor part was taken care of by Ac's wife Olga.



The Markovich Art Family. The photo is missing son Greg, who is also a talented creator.



Moderator Tanja Goropevsek


At the Schwentner Museum House in Vransko, where Lavoslav Schwentner, a bookseller and publisher of poets and writers of modernity, was born, artist Franc Markovič - Aco marked his prolific path. He moved to the Lower Savinja Valley from his native Montenegro in Carinthia with his parents and two brothers as a child. He became known primarily for painting hops, still lives and nature. The fact that Carinthian-Styrian blood flows in it is also reflected in his character: he is stubborn but Carinthian with a sense of humor, said his daughter Nina Markovich Korent at the opening of the exhibition. The event was enhanced by music by Miro Klinc and his daughter Marina and her husband Franjo Oset, also a member of the Modrijani ensemble. The artist's wife, Olga Markovich, who is a tireless cultural creator and president of the Griže Local Community, provided a humorous atmosphere. The exhibition was opened by the mayor of France, Franc Sušnik, and the event was moderated by Tanja Goropevšek from ZTRŠ Vransko. During this time, Aco always stubbornly insisted on his own, albeit often lonely, painting career. He always appreciated freedom, so as an independent cultural worker, in his work he followed his own path and wanted to be different. His showrooms have always been something special. In Serbia, for example, it received the City of Belgrade award for a toy stand, and the exhibition venues for the Velenje Fashion Show were very original. Although reluctant to brag about its successes, let us mention some. At the ex tempore in Piran, when he first participated in this art event, his painting was selected for the first redemption prize. At the exhibition at the Stadt Galerie in Leibnitz, he was the only Slovenian among painters in 1988 and sold all the paintings on the first day. He has received several awards and recognitions, and on the 40th anniversary of his creation the Savin Prize. But not painting because of awards and recognitions, painting because artistic creation is his love, his passion, his mission.


The humor part was taken care of by Ac's wife Olga.

Throughout the years, he has painted hundreds of hops in various techniques, including oil on canvas, acrylic and pastel, and paintings now adorn homes across the Savinja Valley and elsewhere in Slovenia as well as abroad. Very close to him are still life motifs, hunting motifs, landscapes and bouquets motifs and figurines - ancestors, old men, children ... Part of his oeuvre are also roosters, coastal motifs, old boats and old seaside towns. His paintings with coastal motifs adorned the coastal galleries throughout the Adriatic. This year's exhibited works were displayed by his longtime friend August Pikl - Gustl, who has around two hundred of his works in his collection.


Moderator Tanja Goropevsek
